subject: Book Recommendations and Where to put tests?
msgSnippet: Any suggestions on how to organize test cases?  Should they be included in production code packages or separated out into their own JUnitTest package? Also,
messageBody:
Any suggestions on how to organize test cases? Should they be
included in production code packages or separated out into their own
JUnitTest package?

Also, any JUnit book recommendations? I saw JUnit.org lists quite a
few. The books are so expensive, so I'm looking to just get one good
basic one for now. This would include approaches to writing test
cases and using things like mock objects. I notice a new book is
coming out soon called JUnit Recipes? Any advance word on that? Note
that as of now, I'm not using EJB, XML or any goodies like that. I'm
just using the basic java.utils API, though some folks in our group
are also using JMS.

Thanks!

Ken
